<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
 
 PyTorch is supposed to be thread-safe, as long as you don't write a tensor using multiple threads. Please see <denchmark-link:https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/is-pytorch-supposed-to-be-thread-safe/36540/2>https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/is-pytorch-supposed-to-be-thread-safe/36540/2</denchmark-link>
 
 It might be worth removing the validation of sample_async and use_pytorch for A3C (and maybe others?).
 Ray Version 0.9.0dev (but this applies to any ray version actually)
 <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
 
 Please provide a script that can be run to reproduce the issue. The script should have no external library dependencies (i.e., use fake or mock data / environments):
 If we cannot run your script, we cannot fix your issue.
 
  I have verified my script runs in a clean environment and reproduces the issue.
  I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.
